intro: Hieracium distendens, commonly known as the broadleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium distendens is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can often be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
